messages.title: A New Voice for Wales
messages.content: Ian is a local Town and County Councillor and a member of North Wales Police Authority who works hard for Denbighshire and North Wales.

messages.title: A RECORD OF ACTION, A PROMISE OF MORE
messages.content: Ian promised to fight for funding for sporting facilities in St Asaph, to deliver council tax relief to residents, and to support plans for a business park.

messages.title: TIME FOR CHANGE
messages.content: Ian Gunning will provide a strong North Wales voice in the Assembly.

messages.title: GOOD REASONS TO VOTE FOR THE WELSH CONSERVATIVES
messages.content: The leaflet lists three key reasons, including appointing a North Wales Minister, protecting the North Wales health budget, and supporting North Wales schools.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ian vowed to fight against Labour's plans to centralise hospital services and to ensure fair funding to avoid bed cuts.
Pledging to build on the success of local attractions, Ian aimed to create a more tourist-friendly environment via reduced business rates and investment infrastructure.
Promoting local control over school funding and empowering teachers, parents, and governors to make decisions.

mentions.candidate: Ian is a local Town and County Councillor and a member of North Wales Police Authority.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Labour's plans to centralise hospital services.

issues.economy: Reducing business rates for 75% of small businesses and delivering a manufacturing strategy.
issues.education: Empowering teachers, parents, and governors to make decisions concerning schools.
issues.health: Fighting against Labour's plans to centralise hospital services, ensuring a fair funding formula to avoid bed cuts in North Wales.

leaflet.personalStatement: Ian Gunning is described as hardworking and as someone who will provide a strong voice for North Wales in the Assembly.

politicalExperience.role: Town and County Councillor, Member of North Wales Police Authority
politicalExperience.achievements: Fought for funding for sporting facilities, delivered council tax relief, and supported a business park plan in St Asaph.

contactInformation.address: North Wales Conservatives, 29 Russell Road, Rhyl, Denbighshire, LL18 3BS

images.caption: Ian Gunning with pictures of people and Wales.
